s4ngu1n,

        extract the fonts to your desktop. Then go c:\windows\fonts  and either cut and paste them into the fonts folder or drop and drag. They have to go into the windows system fonts folder in order to appear in the photoshop fonts. at least that's the case on my OS (Win XP 3rd Edt.).
Hope this helps.

Thanks for all your work! I am an American military spouse overseas, and finding a job in Germany is dang near impossible. So I have started taking photos for other Americans so we can stop losing money with the Euro exchange rate. I do a lot of baby photo shoots when one parent is deployed during the birth and homecomings. :D With the programs you uploaded, I am able to make my photos even better.

LEGEND! one of PBays best uploaders - 'thethingy' !!!

For anyone who has issues with installing/viewing, you view one-at-a-time just by double-clicking any font,then click the 'install' button if you want to install it (providing you are using Win7 that is)

But obviously because there are several thousand fonts here looking @ them one-by-one can be VERY tedious! so I would suggest you get a Font Management software - just google 'font manager' and see which takes your fancy... most allow you to preview uninstalled fonts,look at several fonts at one time,bulk install/uninstall... there's loads to choose from,not many good free programs in my opinion tho... i use FontAgent at the moment and its really good

LEGEND - 'thethingy' - ONE OF PBAY'S BEST UPLOADERS!

to anyone having problems installing fonts, just search google for 'font management freeware' and pick whichever program takes ur fancy

thanks again!!!!
